books.title: Wings of Fire
books.author: A.P.J. Abdul Kalam with Arun Tiwari
books.description: An inspiring autobiography from Rameswaram to India’s missile programme, written in simple and uplifting prose.

books.title: Malgudi Days
books.author: R.K. Narayan
books.description: Classic short stories capturing everyday life and gentle humour in the fictional South Indian town of Malgudi.

books.title: The Immortals of Meluha
books.author: Amish Tripathi
books.description: A mytho-fantasy retelling of Shiva’s journey, blending action, legend, and philosophy in a fast-paced narrative.

books.title: Monsoon Algorithms
books.author: Anika Rao
books.description: A near-future Bengaluru tech drama about startups, ethics, and a deluge of data.

reviews.text: Amazing message with excellent clarity — I loved the stories and strongly recommend it to students.
A wonderful collection with great charm; I enjoyed the warm, everyday moments and the superb simplicity.
Simple language and steady pace; the plot is clear and the world is easy to follow.
Readable and consistent; the narrative stays focused from start to finish.
I was disappointed — several boring passages and slow chapters, with a few moments that felt horrible.
